result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pretrial VIOLATION  Report 09/27/2022, filed.
Court re-instates justice point at previous level. Court orders previous conditions to remain in full force and effect.

Defendant William Hester Pope appeared by video.  Attorney Michael G. Levine in court for William Hester Pope.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Discussion with parties. Court addresses Pretrial Services Discharge Report. Discovery issues put forth on the record. Defense counsel further requests an adjourned status conference date. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Discharge Report 8.2.22
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 7-18-2022

Defendant William Hester Pope in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference.  Parties request additional time to work through discovery.  Court schedules a status conference to be held via Zoom.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant William Hester Pope in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials, but need additional time to review with client. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-24-2022

Defendant William Hester Pope in court with Attorney Michael G. Levine; both appear by video.  Francesco Mineo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Kelly & MPD Officer A. Verreault. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JPS report

Defendant William Hester Pope in court with attorney Michael Moran on behalf of Michael G. Levine.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appear by video.
Case in court for a Preliminary Hearing. State's witness is present. SPD need more time to appoint counsel on the co-defendant matter. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-24-2022

Defendant William Hester Pope in court with attorney Michael Moran on behalf of Michael G. Levine.  Patrick T. Franken appeared on behalf of Francesco Mineo for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Bail Bond Hearing. Arguments heard as to bail. Court denied state counsel's bail motion for todays purposes. Case remains calendared as previously set.

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant William Hester Pope in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Defendant William Hester Pope in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  William Hester Pope appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Bail Bond Hearing requested by charging ADA.   

Bail Bond Hearing March 21st, 2022 at 08:30am Branch 16.
